verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that one told Joseph, Behold, thy father is sick: and he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.ct: Some time later, Joseph received word that his father was ill. So he went to him, bringing along his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.

verses.kjv: And one told Jacob, and said, Behold, thy son Joseph cometh unto thee: and Israel strengthened himself, and sat upon the bed.
verses.ct: When Jacob was told, "Your son Joseph has come to see you," Israel gathered his strength and sat up on the bed.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto Joseph, God Almighty appeared unto me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and blessed me,
verses.ct: Jacob said to Joseph, "God Almighty appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan and blessed me."

verses.kjv: And said unto me, Behold, I will make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, and I will make of thee a multitude of people; and will give this land to thy seed after thee for an everlasting possession.
verses.ct: "He told me, 'I will make you fruitful and increase your numbers. I will make you into a great assembly of peoples, and I will give this land to your descendants after you as a permanent possession.'"

verses.kjv: And now thy two sons, Ephraim and Manasseh, which were born unto thee in the land of Egypt before I came unto thee into Egypt, are mine; as Reuben and Simeon, they shall be mine.
verses.ct: "Now your two sons, Ephraim and Manasseh, who were born to you in Egypt before I arrived here, will be counted as mine. Just as Reuben and Simeon are mine, so they will be mine."

verses.kjv: And thy issue, which thou begettest after them, shall be thine, and shall be called after the name of their brethren in their inheritance.
verses.ct: "Any children you have after them will be yours, but for their inheritance they will be counted under the names of their brothers."

verses.kjv: And as for me, when I came from Padan, Rachel died by me in the land of Canaan in the way, when yet there was but a little way to come unto Ephrath: and I buried her there in the way of Ephrath; the same is Bethlehem.
verses.ct: "As I was returning from Padan, Rachel died beside me in the land of Canaan while we were still some distance from Ephrath. I buried her there along the road to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem."

verses.kjv: And Israel beheld Joseph’s sons, and said, Who are these?
verses.ct: When Israel noticed Joseph's sons, he asked, "Who are these?"

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his father, They are my sons, whom God hath given me in this place. And he said, Bring them, I pray thee, unto me, and I will bless them.
verses.ct: Joseph replied, "These are my sons, whom God has given me here." Israel said, "Please bring them closer to me so I can bless them."

verses.kjv: Now the eyes of Israel were dim for age, so that he could not see. And he brought them near unto him; and he kissed them, and embraced them.
verses.ct: Israel's eyesight had grown poor because of his old age, and he could no longer see well. So Joseph brought the boys close, and Israel kissed them and held them in his arms.

verses.kjv: And Israel said unto Joseph, I had not thought to see thy face: and, lo, God hath shewed me also thy seed.
verses.ct: Israel said to Joseph, "I never expected to see your face again, yet God has allowed me to see your children as well."

verses.kjv: And Joseph brought them out from between his knees, and he bowed himself with his face to the earth.
verses.ct: Joseph moved them back from between his father's knees and then bowed down with his face to the ground.

verses.kjv: And Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel’s left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel’s right hand, and brought them near unto him.
verses.ct: Joseph positioned both sons—Ephraim at his right hand, facing Israel's left, and Manasseh at his left hand, facing Israel's right—and brought them close to his father.

verses.kjv: And Israel stretched out his right hand, and laid it upon Ephraim’s head, who was the younger, and his left hand upon Manasseh’s head, guiding his hands wittingly; for Manasseh was the firstborn.
verses.ct: But Israel reached out his right hand and placed it on the head of Ephraim, the younger son, and his left hand on Manasseh's head. He crossed his hands deliberately, even though Manasseh was the firstborn.

verses.kjv: And he blessed Joseph, and said, God, before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac did walk, the God which fed me all my life long unto this day,
verses.ct: Then he blessed Joseph, saying, "May the God before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked, the God who has been my shepherd throughout my entire life to this day,

verses.kjv: The Angel which redeemed me from all evil, bless the lads; and let my name be named on them, and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac; and let them grow into a multitude in the midst of the earth.
verses.ct: the Angel who has redeemed me from every harm—may he bless these boys. May my name and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac live on through them, and may they multiply greatly across the earth."

verses.kjv: And when Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand upon the head of Ephraim, it displeased him: and he held up his father’s hand, to remove it from Ephraim’s head unto Manasseh’s head.
verses.ct: When Joseph saw that his father had placed his right hand on Ephraim's head, he was unhappy about it. He grasped his father's hand to move it from Ephraim's head over to Manasseh's head.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his father, Not so, my father: for this is the firstborn; put thy right hand upon his head.
verses.ct: Joseph said to his father, "That's not right, father. This one is the firstborn—place your right hand on his head."

verses.kjv: And his father refused, and said, I know it, my son, I know it: he also shall become a people, and he also shall be great: but truly his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his seed shall become a multitude of nations.
verses.ct: But his father refused and said, "I know, my son, I know. Manasseh will also become a people, and he too will be great. However, his younger brother will surpass him in greatness, and his descendants will become a multitude of nations."

verses.kjv: And he blessed them that day, saying, In thee shall Israel bless, saying, God make thee as Ephraim and as Manasseh: and he set Ephraim before Manasseh.
verses.ct: So he blessed them that day, saying, "The people of Israel will use your names when they pronounce blessings, saying, 'May God make you like Ephraim and like Manasseh.'" In this way, he placed Ephraim ahead of Manasseh.

verses.kjv: And Israel said unto Joseph, Behold, I die: but God shall be with you, and bring you again unto the land of your fathers.
verses.ct: Then Israel said to Joseph, "I am about to die, but God will be with you and will bring you back to the land of your fathers."

verses.kjv: Moreover I have given to thee one portion above thy brethren, which I took out of the hand of the Amorite with my sword and with my bow.
verses.ct: "I am giving you one portion more than your brothers—the land I captured from the Amorites with my sword and my bow."
